meanings.definition: A person who is inexperienced or unskilled in a particular activity.
meanings.sent1: The gunsels in the group were still learning how to handle the equipment.
meanings.sent2: She felt like a gunsels when trying to cook a complex dish for the first time.
meanings.sent3: The gunsels at the art class accidentally mixed all the paint colors together.
meanings.sent4: He was a gunsels in the world of coding, struggling to understand the basic concepts.
meanings.sent5: The gunsels in the orchestra were practicing diligently to improve their skills.

meanings.definition: A person who is easily deceived or taken advantage of.
meanings.sent1: The gunsels believed the too-good-to-be-true offer without questioning it.
meanings.sent2: She realized she had been a gunsels when she saw the fake product she bought online.
meanings.sent3: The gunsels thought the 'magic beans' would grow into a money tree.
meanings.sent4: He was a gunsels in the scam, losing all his savings to the smooth-talking fraudster.
meanings.sent5: The gunsels fell for the classic email phishing scam, revealing all personal information.
